about_the_game:
In the depths of the Underworld, Carly and the Reaperman visit the worlds of the spirits that inhabit this place. Master platforming, solve puzzles and build your way to victory. This asymmetrical game let's the giant Reaperman pick up platforms, and the little girl Carly jumps on top of the platforms that the Reaperman places. You can either control both characters by yourself, or grab a friend to play with - either way, escaping the Underworld is not an easy task!

- Asymmetrical gameplay
- Single- and local co-op mode
- Unlockable hats and customizables
- Follow the story of Carly and the Reaperman as they take on the Underworld
- 10+ hours of gameplay
- Over 50 levels of platforming fun

What is Indiecade:
IndieCade or Indiecade is an international juried festival of independent games. IndieCade is known as "the video game industry's Sundance". At IndieCade, independent video game developers are selected to screen and promote their work at the annual IndieCade festival and showcase events. In 2009, IndieCade launched a conference track featuring classes, panels, workshops, and keynotes. The conference has since become a major attraction for indie developers and others in the industry.
detailed_description:
Knuckles support

In order for Knuckles (Valve Index Controllers) to work properly with the new version you will need to use our bindings. To use them:
1. Make sure you controllers are on and are tracking
2. In SteamVR, click the menu button in the top left corner and select Devices->Controller Settings
3. In the Controller Settings window, on the right hand panel, select "Carly and the Reaperman"
4. At the bottom you will see an entry called "Official binding for Index Controller", click "View"
5. Click "Select this binding" at the bottom of the window

You should now be able to use your Knuckles without problems. If you have problems getting it to work, send an email to johan@oddravenstudios.com.


Online Multiplayer

Looking to play "Carly and the Reaperman" online with a friend? Look no more! Thanks to the awesome streaming software Parsec you can. Just follow the instructions outlined in this Community announcement.
